summary: okay so I know the Rogue Avengers(tm) were on the run from multiple governments and everything but the thing is in this day and...
body: okay so I know the Rogue Avengers™ were on the run from multiple governments and everything but the thing is in this day and age when you see people like. doing that or standing up against the government in general they usually stay somewhat active on social media and whatnot so I’m kinda imaging with how fucking dramatic they are, they just all change their twitter handles to like ‘The Rogue Falcon’ and ‘Rogue Black Widow’ and ‘Rogue Cap’ you know something simple that gets the point across. but for the most part they change nothing about their activity like Sam’s just still retweeting an occasional meme and fanart of him, Nat’s still posting cryptic shit that everyone’s a little afraid to try and deceiver, every few months Wanda will sign on, post some food pic or a blurry selfie of her and Vision with no caption and sign off again. Steve had never been active on the site to begin with because he’s too busy to figure it out but one day something sets him Off™ and he goes on a whole rant about the accords and secretary ross and the state of world politics like this is the longest thread you’ll ever see he is righteously furious you know. anyway the most liked and retweeted tweet from this thread ended up not being from Steve, no, but it was a reply from Tony Stark that just simply read ‘turn your fucking location off dumbass’

title: The Prince's Engineer
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2Omri5z

by barelycoherent

A fairy tale adventure about a brilliant young man and his one true love. When the kingdom’s favorite engineer is kidnapped, the only person who can save him returns from oceans away. Together, the lovers must overcome the evils of the mythical kingdom of America to be reunited with each other.
Crossover with the William Goldman novel “The Princess Bride.”
Or:
Tony reminded me of Buttercup so vividly and Steve is such a Westley that I couldn’t help but write a Princess Bride AU with gratuitous fairy tale tropes and references to as many Marvel characters as I could possibly fit in. (Also, I skipped the sexism.)

Words: 19088, Chapters: 1/5, Language: English

Под железом всего лишь человек.

Он не железный, не суперсолдат, не человек со сверхспособностями, не человек со зверем внутри, не бог и не агент. Он всего лишь механик-гений, на плечи которого легла ответственность за весь мир.

Он просто Тони

Do you know how i know?

There’s nothing on this earth that makes you want to gauge your eyes out and smash your head into a wall untill your head is a bloody pulp more than Marvel fandom , HP fandom and K-pop fandom.

I deserve this PAIN.

title: Beyond Death
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2A6lFjs

by CommanderNova

“They never told me how pretty you were,” the creature spoke, slowly rising up from his seat and making his way over to where Peter was standing, completely frozen. He felt like prey being stalked by a predator, like Lord Stark was going to devour him whole, and he figured it wasn’t too far from the truth. “I suppose you’re here to kill me then?”

summary:
Ok but bbyvengers
Some b-list magic using villain of the day casts a spell and half the avengers get de-aged into small toddlers...
body:
Ok but bbyvengers

  • Some b-list magic using villain of the day casts a spell and half the avengers get de-aged into small toddlers
  • This includes Clint,Natasha, Bruce, Sam, and Steve.
  • That leaves tony, Thor, vision, and Bucky as adults.
  • Thor and vision end up chasing the villain leaving tony and Bucky behind to wrangle five confused toddlers.
  • The babyvengers don’t exactly remember who tony and Bucky are but they are familiar enough that the kids trust them
  • Tony’s mom mode is activated immediately obv and is like
  • QUINJET. NOW. COMe alONG CHildREN :))))
  • Bucky like shm I have to cover ur asses again u tiny punks
  • But then Thor n vis come back with the villain n tow and they all head back to shield hq for a little while just to sort things out and get the tykes checked out by medical.
  • It’s after each kid is check out that the remaining adult avengers discover that it was definitely magic.
  • Bruce and Sam are older being six and five respectively, Clint is four (and three quarters!), while Natasha and Steve are three. Although Steve looks like he’s five because of the serum. everyone knows their names and age, none of them really know what’s going on beyond that and it seems the only memories they have are of their lives up until their specific age.
  • Natasha can understand some English but can’t speak it, so Bucky and Thor translate. Bruce is just too shy and anxious to speak much but Clint, Sam, and Steve talk plenty.
  • Much to Buckys charge in
  • Natasha is surprisingly clingy and never leaves Tony or buckys side
  • Clint loves to climb on top of Thor’s shoulders cuz now he’s the tallest!
  • Sam is fascinated with vision and so is Bruce but he’s still a little timid
  • Steve just loves everybody
  • Thor gets ahold of Loki because ‘Loki is great with children trust me man of iron my brother has children of his own he will know what to do and can help reverse the magic that caused this’
  • Tony agrees but only hesitantly
  • Vision and Friday screen hundreds of child care books and websites because kids? What??
  • Tony ends up buying them all their respective avengers themed indies to wear because there clothes didn’t exactly shrink with them whoops
  • He constantly frets over them and wants to coddle them constantly because the babyvengers are just too cute and innocent and pure and ahhhhhh
  • He reads them all bed time stories, plays games with them, makes sure their fed and everything.
  • Loki is just as bad
  • Thor can’t stop beaming at his brother.
  • Just…aaaaahhhhh
  • The whole thing is a cuteness overload

I just really love babyvengers ok?

  • Natasha is surprisingly clingy and never leaves Tony or buckys side
  • Clint loves to climb on top of Thor’s shoulders cuz now he’s the tallest!
  • Sam is fascinated with vision and so is Bruce but he’s still a little timid
  • Steve just loves everybody
  • Thor gets ahold of Loki because ‘Loki is great with children trust me man of iron my brother has children of his own he will know what to do and can help reverse the magic that caused this’
  • Tony agrees but only hesitantly
  • Vision and Friday screen hundreds of child care books and websites because kids? What??
  • Tony ends up buying them all their respective avengers themed indies to wear because there clothes didn’t exactly shrink with them whoops
  • He constantly frets over them and wants to coddle them constantly because the babyvengers are just too cute and innocent and pure and ahhhhhh
  • He reads them all bed time stories, plays games with them, makes sure their fed and everything.
  • Loki is just as bad
  • Thor can’t stop beaming at his brother.
  • Just…aaaaahhhhh
  • The whole thing is a cuteness overload

I just really love babyvengers ok?

title: THE BOYFRIEND EXPERIENCE
body:
TONY STARK x READER
WORD COUNT : 2089
WARNINGS : EXTRA FLUFF
REQUESTED BY : @technolilly (Thank you!)

SUMMARY : Tony had recently confessed his feelings for you, and having liked him for quite some time, you couldn’t be more relieved. But can you put aside your nervousness and inexperience to give a relationship with him a try?

“Uh, I gotta go, um, check some emails.”

You had joined Tony, who had just recently confessed his feelings for you, and some of the Avengers in the common room for a late night movie. You had initially taken a seat in one of the arm chairs, but before the film had started, Tony had pulled you over to the couch to sit beside him.

He had grabbed one of the throw blankets and laid it across the two of you as he pulled you cozily into his side. He rested his arm on the back of the couch and lazily played with your hair, gently massaging your scalp with his finger tips.

Peter sat on the floor in front of the couch on the other side of Tony’s legs, eyes glued to the action film the entire time. Bucky, Steve, and Sam each took up a sofa sack towards the front of the room, while Wanda curled up in one of the arm chairs.

The room was dark, lit only by the light of the flat screen TV, and the two of you had the couch to yourselves. Halfway through the film, Tony had grown completely bored of the movie and had turned all of his attention to you. He had moved his hand to your shoulder, his thumb softly rubbing the small bit of exposed skin of your collarbone, and placed soft, quiet kisses to your head.

“Come here,” he whispered in your ear, so soft that only you could hear. He nudged you with his nose, encouraging him to look at you. With every touch of his fingertips and every soft kiss he had pressed on you, the butterflies in your stomach had fluttered, but when you finally turned your face towards him they burst into full flight.

A sweet smirk teased the edges of his mouth as he bit his bottom lip, and his gaze danced between your eyes and your lips. In the weeks that had passed since he’d admitted that he liked you, the two of you had only kissed briefly a few times, as you hardly had the time to be alone between jobs and missions.

He leaned in and kissed you, softly at first to test the waters. But soon, he lost himself in it, and was instinctively pulling you closer to him while the kiss built in passion. You followed your own desires and sunk into the kiss, and within minutes you the two of you were making out with you halfway in his lap while the rest of the room was entirely oblivious to anything but the movie.

All at once you became equally aware of how pleasantly your body was reacting to his touch and how you actually had no idea what you were doing, and the knowledge of the latter fact echoed in your head, causing every nervous fiber in your body to freeze. You immediately broke the kiss, and fell back into the couch and off of his lap.

“Uh, I gotta go, um, check some emails,” you murmured as you tossed the blanket off your lap and clumsily jumped up off the couch to rush to your room.

You closed the door behind you and immediately threw yourself face first onto the bed, burying your face in your pillow. You let out a long, muffled groan and internally cursed yourself for panicking.

All you wanted was to kiss Tony. Everytime you looked at him, all you wanted was him. Even before he had confessed his feelings for you, all you thought about was him, and you spent all your time imagining what it would be like for him to like you, to hold you, to kiss you, to…

You lifted your head up out of the pillow when there was a soft knock at your door.

“Please don’t be Tony, please don’t be Tony, please don’t be Tony,” you whispered to yourself as you approached the door.

You’d spent months wondering what would happen, what you would do if he ever showed up at your door, but now you had probably ruined any chance of it being anything good, and he was the last person you wanted to face.

“Tony,” you said awkwardly with a half-forced smile when you found him on the other side of your door.

“What did I do wrong?” he asked immediately.

“What? Oh, nothing! I just- emails, you know?” You stammered with a forced laugh, embarrassed that he was blaming himself for your trepidation.

“No, I don’t know, babe,” he said, “You’re notorious for staying on top of your work, so you wouldn’t be behind on your emails, and who would be emailing you at midnight on a Saturday? I did something wrong. What did I do wrong?”

Babe. He called you ‘babe’. He had called you ‘beautiful’ on occasion when he was flirting with you when you first joined the team, but by his reputation you knew you certainly weren’t the first, and aside from that he had only ever called you by your name, which still sounded sweet enough on his lips. But ‘babe’… that made your heart skip a beat.

“You didn’t do anything wrong, I promise,” you sighed as you walked away from the door frame and leaned back against your desk. You stared at your feet and chewed on your lip, trying to find the words to explain how you felt.

You heard the door click shut, and soon Tony stood in front of you with his arms crossed. He nudged your foot with his to get you to look up at him.

“What is it, then? If you don’t like me, I get it. I won’t blame you,” he said softly, “Just tell me so I don’t get my hopes up.”

“No!” you nearly shouted, terrified that he’d think you were anything less than head-over-heels for him, “I like you! A lot!”

“Then what is it?” he pleaded, taking a step closer to you.

“This is my first…” you sighed, struggling to find the right word, not knowing if relationship was exactly what it was yet, as you hadn’t exactly become ‘official’.

“Oh! Shit! I had no idea, I’m so sorry,” he said, his eyes wide with surprise and regret, “that wasn’t at all what I was trying to do back there- I mean, that would’ve been great if it turned into that- but that wasn’t my intention! I just really wanted to kiss you. I really like kissing you. But I’m sorry if you felt like you had to- we don’t have to do that if you’re not ready! We can wait, or not do it at all, or whatever you want! Really, I-”

“Tony!” you interrupted, the flush of your cheeks turning as red as his Iron Man suit, “that’s not what I meant! I mean, that’s part of it, but that’s not specifically what I meant.”

He took a tiny step back, his brow knitting in confusion. “You’re losing me here, babe. What do you mean?”

You took a deep breath and organized the words in your head before stating them, wanting to finally be as honest and as clear as possible.

“I’ve never been in a relationship.”

You saw his expression change and his eyes widen again as he took in the words you said and finally understood what you meant.

“Ohhh,” he said, “wait, really?”

“Yep.”

“But… how?” he said, tilting his head as confusion washed over him again, “You’re gorgeous, you’re brilliant, you’re funny…”

“I don’t know, I just… never really had the time, and when I did have the time, if I even found someone I actually I liked, I didn’t have the confidence to try. I’ve kissed like, three guys, but they weren’t real kisses. One was during the only round of spin the bottle I ever played in high school, one was when I was drunk on my 21st birthday, and one was to get out of a dodgy situation on a mission.”

“But you do like me?” he asked curiously.

“Yes,” you insisted, “a lot.”

“So, if you like me, and you know I like you too- so much, by the way, so so much- then what’s the issue here?”

You dropped your gaze to your feet again, afraid of being so vulnerable with someone for the first time, especially with someone whos reputation makes your insecurities that much harder to ignore.

“I… I just get nervous,” you whispered, “I don’t know what I’m doing. I don’t know how to be flirty or sexy or intimate. This is all new to me. Even just making out with you is new to me. I’m just terrified of doing something stupid or wrong or just messing up, especially with someone like you.”

“Like me?” he whispered, hesitantly taking another tiny step closer to you.

“Someone with your reputation. Your… experience,” you sighed, “I can’t match up to that.”

He let out a quiet laugh as he uncrossed his arms and delicately placed his hands on your hips, closing most of the distance that was left between the two of you. You looked up at him, hoping that the tears that threatened to break the surface didn’t show, but the soft smile on his lips warmed your frozen nerves.

“First off, I don’t want you to flirt with me. I want you to be yourself with me. Secondly, you are the sexiest woman I have ever laid eyes on,” he smirked, “and did I mention mention that you’re gorgeous? And brilliant? And funny? I know I have a reputation, I know that. But the moment I met you, I wished that I could take all of that back, because I realized that all of my time had been wasted. None of them compared to you, babe. Not a damn one. I just want you, babe, in whatever ways you’ll have me.”

As hard as you had fought against them, a few tears managed to escape and roll down your cheeks, but instead of insecurity, these were out of relief. You let out a laugh as you wiped them away, and then confidently wrapped your arms around his neck.

“Okay,” you sniffled.

“Okay?” he grinned, resting his forehead against yours.

“I’m wanna try,” you smiled, “I’m not promising I won’t get nervous, and I’m not saying I don’t want to take it slow, but I do want to try. And I want you… in a few different ways…”

“Really,” he cooed, giving your hips a soft squeeze as he relished in how effortlessly you made him feel like the luckiest man alive, “and what ways are those, exactly?”

“Well, for starters…”

You mustered every ounce of confidence you could find in yourself, and then leaned up and kissed him. Slowly, but surely, and without pulling back. Your fingers toyed with the hair at the nape of his neck as he sunk into the kiss, moaning quietly against your lips.

Just as your hands began to wander down to his chest and one of his hands traveled down to softly grab your ass, he let out a heavy exhale as he broke the kiss.

“Slow,” he stated with a smirk, more as a reminder to himself than to you, “How about this. You get some sleep, and then you and I are going to spend the day together. We’ll go do all of the cheesy, cliche couple-y things. I’m going to give you the full boyfriend experience.”

“So is that what you are?” You teased.

“Well I certainly hope so…” he said, feigning offense that you’d think otherwise, earning a giggle out of you.

“So, tomorrow?” You confirmed.

“Tomorrow.”

He placed a quick kiss to your lips and then one to the tip of your nose, and then turned and headed for the door. You followed him and held it open for him.

“Wait,” he said, turning on his heel just after he stepped into the hallway, “you said you kissed someone on a mission. Who?”

“Uhhh, don’t worry about it,” you giggled, quickly shutting the door in his face and locking it. You leaned your back against the door for a second with an uncontrollable smile on your face and a new-found confidence in your new relationship.

And just when you were about to walk away and head to bed, you could’ve sworn you heard Tony grumble “I swear to god, if it was Steve…” as he walked away, throwing you into a whole new state of panic.

MASTERLIST

He had called you ‘beautiful’ on occasion when he was flirting with you when you first joined the team, but by his reputation you knew you certainly weren’t the first, and aside from that he had only ever called you by your name, which still sounded sweet enough on his lips. But ‘babe’… that made your heart skip a beat.

“You didn’t do anything wrong, I promise,” you sighed as you walked away from the door frame and leaned back against your desk. You stared at your feet and chewed on your lip, trying to find the words to explain how you felt.

You heard the door click shut, and soon Tony stood in front of you with his arms crossed. He nudged your foot with his to get you to look up at him.

“What is it, then? If you don’t like me, I get it. I won’t blame you,” he said softly, “Just tell me so I don’t get my hopes up.”

“No!” you nearly shouted, terrified that he’d think you were anything less than head-over-heels for him, “I like you! A lot!”

“Then what is it?” he pleaded, taking a step closer to you.

“This is my first…” you sighed, struggling to find the right word, not knowing if relationship was exactly what it was yet, as you hadn’t exactly become ‘official’.

“Oh! Shit! I had no idea, I’m so sorry,” he said, his eyes wide with surprise and regret, “that wasn’t at all what I was trying to do back there- I mean, that would’ve been great if it turned into that- but that wasn’t my intention! I just really wanted to kiss you. I really like kissing you. But I’m sorry if you felt like you had to- we don’t have to do that if you’re not ready! We can wait, or not do it at all, or whatever you want! Really, I-”

“Tony!” you interrupted, the flush of your cheeks turning as red as his Iron Man suit, “that’s not what I meant! I mean, that’s part of it, but that’s not specifically what I meant.”

He took a tiny step back, his brow knitting in confusion. “You’re losing me here, babe. What do you mean?”

You took a deep breath and organized the words in your head before stating them, wanting to finally be as honest and as clear as possible.

“I’ve never been in a relationship.”

You saw his expression change and his eyes widen again as he took in the words you said and finally understood what you meant.

“Ohhh,” he said, “wait, really?”

“Yep.”

“But… how?” he said, tilting his head as confusion washed over him again, “You’re gorgeous, you’re brilliant, you’re funny…”

“I don’t know, I just… never really had the time, and when I did have the time, if I even found someone I actually I liked, I didn’t have the confidence to try. I’ve kissed like, three guys, but they weren’t real kisses. One was during the only round of spin the bottle I ever played in high school, one was when I was drunk on my 21st birthday, and one was to get out of a dodgy situation on a mission.”

“But you do like me?” he asked curiously.

“Yes,” you insisted, “a lot.”

“So, if you like me, and you know I like you too- so much, by the way, so so much- then what’s the issue here?”

You dropped your gaze to your feet again, afraid of being so vulnerable with someone for the first time, especially with someone whos reputation makes your insecurities that much harder to ignore.

“I… I just get nervous,” you whispered, “I don’t know what I’m doing. I don’t know how to be flirty or sexy or intimate. This is all new to me. Even just making out with you is new to me. I’m just terrified of doing something stupid or wrong or just messing up, especially with someone like you.”

“Like me?” he whispered, hesitantly taking another tiny step closer to you.

“Someone with your reputation. Your… experience,” you sighed, “I can’t match up to that.”

He let out a quiet laugh as he uncrossed his arms and delicately placed his hands on your hips, closing most of the distance that was left between the two of you. You looked up at him, hoping that the tears that threatened to break the surface didn’t show, but the soft smile on his lips warmed your frozen nerves.

“First off, I don’t want you to flirt with me. I want you to be yourself with me. Secondly, you are the sexiest woman I have ever laid eyes on,” he smirked, “and did I mention mention that you’re gorgeous? And brilliant? And funny? I know I have a reputation, I know that. But the moment I met you, I wished that I could take all of that back, because I realized that all of my time had been wasted. None of them compared to you, babe. Not a damn one. I just want you, babe, in whatever ways you’ll have me.”

As hard as you had fought against them, a few tears managed to escape and roll down your cheeks, but instead of insecurity, these were out of relief. You let out a laugh as you wiped them away, and then confidently wrapped your arms around his neck.

“Okay,” you sniffled.

“Okay?” he grinned, resting his forehead against yours.

“I’m wanna try,” you smiled, “I’m not promising I won’t get nervous, and I’m not saying I don’t want to take it slow, but I do want to try. And I want you… in a few different ways…”

“Really,” he cooed, giving your hips a soft squeeze as he relished in how effortlessly you made him feel like the luckiest man alive, “and what ways are those, exactly?”

“Well, for starters…”

You mustered every ounce of confidence you could find in yourself, and then leaned up and kissed him. Slowly, but surely, and without pulling back. Your fingers toyed with the hair at the nape of his neck as he sunk into the kiss, moaning quietly against your lips.

Just as your hands began to wander down to his chest and one of his hands traveled down to softly grab your ass, he let out a heavy exhale as he broke the kiss.

“Slow,” he stated with a smirk, more as a reminder to himself than to you, “How about this. You get some sleep, and then you and I are going to spend the day together. We’ll go do all of the cheesy, cliche couple-y things. I’m going to give you the full boyfriend experience.”

“So is that what you are?” You teased.

“Well I certainly hope so…” he said, feigning offense that you’d think otherwise, earning a giggle out of you.

“So, tomorrow?” You confirmed.

“Tomorrow.”

He placed a quick kiss to your lips and then one to the tip of your nose, and then turned and headed for the door. You followed him and held it open for him.

“Wait,” he said, turning on his heel just after he stepped into the hallway, “you said you kissed someone on a mission. Who?”

“Uhhh, don’t worry about it,” you giggled, quickly shutting the door in his face and locking it. You leaned your back against the door for a second with an uncontrollable smile on your face and a new-found confidence in your new relationship.

And just when you were about to walk away and head to bed, you could’ve sworn you heard Tony grumble “I swear to god, if it was Steve…” as he walked away, throwing you into a whole new state of panic.

“Oh! Shit! I had no idea, I’m so sorry,” he said, his eyes wide with surprise and regret, “that wasn’t at all what I was trying to do back there- I mean, that would’ve been great if it turned into that- but that wasn’t my intention! I just really wanted to kiss you. I really like kissing you. But I’m sorry if you felt like you had to- we don’t have to do that if you’re not ready! We can wait, or not do it at all, or whatever you want! Really, I-”

“Tony!” you interrupted, the flush of your cheeks turning as red as his Iron Man suit, “that’s not what I meant! I mean, that’s part of it, but that’s not specifically what I meant.”

He took a tiny step back, his brow knitting in confusion. “You’re losing me here, babe. What do you mean?”

You took a deep breath and organized the words in your head before stating them, wanting to finally be as honest and as clear as possible.

“I’ve never been in a relationship.”

You saw his expression change and his eyes widen again as he took in the words you said and finally understood what you meant.

“Ohhh,” he said, “wait, really?”

“Yep.”

“But… how?” he said, tilting his head as confusion washed over him again, “You’re gorgeous, you’re brilliant, you’re funny…”

“I don’t know, I just… never really had the time, and when I did have the time, if I even found someone I actually I liked, I didn’t have the confidence to try. I’ve kissed like, three guys, but they weren’t real kisses. One was during the only round of spin the bottle I ever played in high school, one was when I was drunk on my 21st birthday, and one was to get out of a dodgy situation on a mission.”

“But you do like me?” he asked curiously.

“Yes,” you insisted, “a lot.”

“So, if you like me, and you know I like you too- so much, by the way, so so much- then what’s the issue here?”

You dropped your gaze to your feet again, afraid of being so vulnerable with someone for the first time, especially with someone whos reputation makes your insecurities that much harder to ignore.

“I… I just get nervous,” you whispered, “I don’t know what I’m doing. I don’t know how to be flirty or sexy or intimate. This is all new to me. Even just making out with you is new to me. I’m just terrified of doing something stupid or wrong or just messing up, especially with someone like you.”

“Like me?” he whispered, hesitantly taking another tiny step closer to you.

“Someone with your reputation. Your… experience,” you sighed, “I can’t match up to that.”

He let out a quiet laugh as he uncrossed his arms and delicately placed his hands on your hips, closing most of the distance that was left between the two of you. You looked up at him, hoping that the tears that threatened to break the surface didn’t show, but the soft smile on his lips warmed your frozen nerves.

“First off, I don’t want you to flirt with me. I want you to be yourself with me. Secondly, you are the sexiest woman I have ever laid eyes on,” he smirked, “and did I mention mention that you’re gorgeous? And brilliant? And funny? I know I have a reputation, I know that. But the moment I met you, I wished that I could take all of that back, because I realized that all of my time had been wasted. None of them compared to you, babe. Not a damn one. I just want you, babe, in whatever ways you’ll have me.”

As hard as you had fought against them, a few tears managed to escape and roll down your cheeks, but instead of insecurity, these were out of relief. You let out a laugh as you wiped them away, and then confidently wrapped your arms around his neck.

“Okay,” you sniffled.

“Okay?” he grinned, resting his forehead against yours.

“I’m wanna try,” you smiled, “I’m not promising I won’t get nervous, and I’m not saying I don’t want to take it slow, but I do want to try. And I want you… in a few different ways…”

“Really,” he cooed, giving your hips a soft squeeze as he relished in how effortlessly you made him feel like the luckiest man alive, “and what ways are those, exactly?”

“Well, for starters…”

You mustered every ounce of confidence you could find in yourself, and then leaned up and kissed him. Slowly, but surely, and without pulling back. Your fingers toyed with the hair at the nape of his neck as he sunk into the kiss, moaning quietly against your lips.

Just as your hands began to wander down to his chest and one of his hands traveled down to softly grab your ass, he let out a heavy exhale as he broke the kiss.

“Slow,” he stated with a smirk, more as a reminder to himself than to you, “How about this. You get some sleep, and then you and I are going to spend the day together. We’ll go do all of the cheesy, cliche couple-y things. I’m going to give you the full boyfriend experience.”

“So is that what you are?” You teased.

“Well I certainly hope so…” he said, feigning offense that you’d think otherwise, earning a giggle out of you.

“So, tomorrow?” You confirmed.

“Tomorrow.”

He placed a quick kiss to your lips and then one to the tip of your nose, and then turned and headed for the door. You followed him and held it open for him.

“Wait,” he said, turning on his heel just after he stepped into the hallway, “you said you kissed someone on a mission. Who?”

“Uhhh, don’t worry about it,” you giggled, quickly shutting the door in his face and locking it. You leaned your back against the door for a second with an uncontrollable smile on your face and a new-found confidence in your new relationship.

And just when you were about to walk away and head to bed, you could’ve sworn you heard Tony grumble “I swear to god, if it was Steve…” as he walked away, throwing you into a whole new state of panic.
